text: Janet Davison Rowley (April 5, 1925 - December 17, 2013) was an American geneticist. She was the first scientist to identify a chromosomal translocation as the cause of leukemia and other cancers in humans. Rowley died at the age of 88 from complications of ovarian cancer. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2013 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Chicago Category:Deaths from ovarian cancer Category:American geneticists Category:Scientists from New York City
title: Janet Rowley
